head.citation-title: Precision Thermoset-Spherical Nano- and Microparticles Formation in Nanoconfinement: A Model Case From Benzoxazine Polymerization in the Blend System With Aromatic Containing Thermoplastic Resin
head.abstracts: © 2017 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.At present, obtaining uniform polymeric micro- and nano-particles is the point to be challenged. The present work proposed is the reaction-induced phase separation under the specific interaction between thermoplastic matrices and the thermoset monomer as a process to produce the thermoset micro- and nanoparticles. The blend system between benzoxazine (BZ) monomer and the aromatic is a good example of size controllable particles because (1) the oxazine ring in the BZ monomer provides -. stacking interaction with the aromatic ring of thermoplastics, (2) the simple thermal treatment of the monomer leads to an in-situ polymerization without the need of additional hardeners, and (3) the variation of amines and phenols is possible. By simply changing the types of thermoplastics, the specific interaction between BZ monomer and thermoplastic induces at the molecular level resulting in narrowly dispersed micro- and nano-particles. Combining this approach with the electrospinning process, the nanofibers further control the BZ polymerization in the nanoconfinement to obtain the BZ thermoset nanoparticles.

source.sourcetitle-abbrev: Adv. and Emerg. Polybenzoxazine Sci. and Technol.
